articles.author: Anna Tong
articles.description: Worldcoin, a cryptocurrency project founded by OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, launches on Monday.
articles.title: OpenAI's Sam Altman launches Worldcoin crypto project

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An electric truck which was previously damaged reignited at Nikola's (NKLA.O) Phoenix, Arizona headquarters on Sunday afternoon but there were no injuries, the electric-truck maker said in a statement.
articles.title: Nikola says damaged truck reignites at its headquarters

articles.author: Corina Pons, Elisa Anzolin
articles.description: As Southern Europe battles extreme heat with no end in sight, people have rushed out to buy fans and even invest in air-conditioning to keep cool.
articles.title: Southern Europeans splash out on air-con as heatwave drags on

articles.author: Aditi Shah, Aditya Kalra
articles.description: Tesla representatives are set to meet India’s commerce minister this month to discuss plans to build a factory to produce what the company has described as an all-new $24,000 car, a person with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Tesla to discuss factory plan for new $24,000 car with India commerce minister -source

articles.author: Jonathan Cable
articles.description: Euro zone business activity shrank much more than expected in July as demand in the bloc's dominant services industry declined while factory output fell at the fastest pace since COVID-19 first took hold, a survey showed.
articles.title: Worsening euro zone business downturn reignites recession fears

articles.author: Yuvraj Malik, Aditya Soni
articles.description: U.S. tech giants could signal an end to the nearly year-long slowdown in their cloud businesses as signs of economic resilience encourage clients to boost technology spending, while a pickup in digital ads will also aid profits.
articles.title: Big Tech looks to turn the corner on cloud as AI focus stays strong

articles.author: Savyata Mishra
articles.description: The fanfare around Margot Robbie-starrer "Barbie" could jolt the iconic Mattel (MAT.O) doll's sales out of a year-long slump, but Wall Street thinks the party in pink will be short-lived.
articles.title: 'Barbie' buzz likely just a flash in the pan for toymaker Mattel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two Ukraine-launched drones attacked Moscow early on Monday, but were intercepted and destroyed, Russia's defence ministry said. State news agencies reported that drone fragments were found 2 kilometres (1.2 miles) away from the ministry's buildings.
articles.title: Russia says it thwarts Ukrainian drone attack on Moscow

articles.author: Fedja Grulovic
articles.description: Tour operators began flying home holidaymakers as wildfires raged on the Greek island of Rhodes on Monday and officials said the threat of further fires was high in almost every region of the country.
articles.title: Tourists flown home as wildfires rage on Greek islands

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A small group of protesters in Denmark on Monday set fire to a copy of the Koran, Islam's holy book, in front of the Iraqi embassy in Copenhagen, risking a further deterioration of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
articles.title: Protesters burn Koran in front of Iraqi embassy in Denmark
